com.robopupu.api.feature

Interface Feature

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PluginComponent, PluginStateComponent, PresenterListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFeature

    public interface Feature
extends PresenterListener, PluginStateComponent
    Feature defines an interface for PluginStateComponents that implement of application feature as a component. A concrete Feature implementation may implement logic for UI navigation and UI flow logic. A Feature is also a DependencyScopeOwner that provides a DependencyScope for providing dependencies.

      • getActiveViews

        java.util.List<FeatureView> getActiveViews()
        Gets the currently active FeatureViews.

        Returns:

      • addActiveView

        FeatureView addActiveView(FeatureView view)
        Adds the given FeatureView to the set of currently active FeatureViews of this Feature.
        Parameters:
        view - A FeatureView to be added.
        Returns:
        The FeatureView if it was added as a new active FeatureView.

        Removes the given FeatureView from the set of currently active FeatureViews of this Feature.
        Parameters:
        view - A FeatureView to be removed.
        Returns:
        The FeatureView if it was removed from being an active FeatureView.

        Returns:

        Clears the back stack managed by FragmentManager.

        Returns:
        A boolean value.

      • goBack

        void goBack()
        Goes back to previous FeatureView.

      • pause

        void pause(boolean finishing)
        Invoked to pause this Feature.
        Parameters:
        finishing - A boolean value indicating if the Feature is going to be finished i.e. it is not resumed nor restarted anymore.

      • finish

        void finish()
        Finishes this Feature. A finished Feature is stopped and destroyed. If a Feature is implements a PluginComponent it is unplugged from a PluginBus.

      • showView

        FeatureView showView(java.lang.Class<? extends Presenter> presenterClass,
                     boolean addToBackStack,
                     Params... params)
        Shows the FeatureView attached to the specified Presenter.
        Parameters:
        presenterClass - A Class specifying the Presenter.
        addToBackStack - A boolean value specifying if the FeatureView is added to back stack.
        params - Optional Params.
        Returns:
        A FeatureView. May be PlugInvoker.

      • showView

        FeatureView showView(int featureContainerId,
                     java.lang.Class<? extends Presenter> presenterClass,
                     boolean addToBackStack,
                     java.lang.String tag,
                     Params... params)
        Shows the FeatureView attached to the specified Presenter. The FeatureView is shown using the specified FeatureContainer.
        Parameters:
        featureContainerId - An id of the FeatureContainer.
        presenterClass - A Class specifying the Presenter.
        addToBackStack - A boolean value specifying if the FeatureView is to be added to back stack.
        tag - A tag for the FeatureView used for FragmentTransaction. May be null.
        params - Optional Params.
        Returns:
        A FeatureView. May be PlugInvoker.

      • showView

        FeatureView showView(FeatureTransitionManager transitionManager,
                     java.lang.Class<? extends Presenter> presenterClass,
                     boolean addToBackStack,
                     java.lang.String tag,
                     Params... params)
        Shows the FeatureView attached to the specified Presenter. The FeatureView is shown using the given FeatureTransitionManager.
        Parameters:
        transitionManager - A FeatureTransitionManager.
        presenterClass - A Class specifying the Presenter.
        addToBackStack - A boolean value specifying if the FeatureView is to be added to back stack.
        tag - A tag for the FeatureView used for FragmentTransaction. May be null.
        params - Optional Params.
        Returns:
        A FeatureView. May be PlugInvoker.
